translated: The Stories of Eighty-Four Thousand Nuns
were yours in the past, Great Sage.
Born into the Sudda and merchant families,
many maidens from the four continents,
were yours in the past, Great Sage.

analyzed: phusissanti anāgate  anubhotvā yasam sabba  patvāna sabba sampadā
translated: will attain in the future.🔽Having experienced all fame,🔽and attained all perfection,
they will awaken in the future.
we pay homage at your feet, Visionary.

analyzed: upāhatā bhavā sabbe  mūla taṇhā samūha tā
translated: All existences are destroyed,🔽craving at the root is uprooted,
the aggregates of merit are opened up.
All are the domain of concentration,

analyzed: samāpatti vasī katā  jhānena dhamma ratiyā
translated: mastered in attainment,🔽we will always dwell
in the joy of meditation and the Dhamma.
And the mental formations have been destroyed;
Having gone to the place that is so hard to see,
“You have been a help to me,
For a long time you have done what is to be done;
Having cut off doubt about the four noble truths,

analyzed: sabbāḥ gacchantu nibbuti  vanditvā muninā u pāde
translated: May you all go to Nibbāna.”🔽Having worshipped the Sage’s feet,
They showed the moon and sun,
And the ocean with its waves;🔽They showed Sineru and the surrounding mountains,
They showed the Yāma realm by their psychic power;
The Tusita gods, the Nimmānarati gods,
And a very valuable walking path;
Having created the appearance of Brahmā,
And having shown the Teacher’s psychic power,
And the knowledge of the minds of others,
we have become powerful, Great Sage.
there is no more renewed existence.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, the phrasing,
and in the replies, just so;
The knowledge has arisen in us, Great Hero,
The meeting with the former Lords of the World,
Whatever wholesome deeds we have done,
The monks were blocked by the river,
and could not get to go.

original: gamanaṁ na labhanti te.🔽Tadā ahu sattasāro,
analyzed: gamanam na labhanti te  tadā ahu satta sāraḥ
translated: they could not get to go.🔽At that time there was a hermit,
Seeing the monks who had crossed over,
he had a bridge built over the Ganges.
he had a bridge built over the Ganges;
On this side of the river for the Saṅgha,

analyzed: vihārañca akārayi  itthiyaḥ purisā ca iva
translated: he also had a monastery built.🔽Women and men,

analyzed: ucca nīca kulāni ca  tassa setum vihārañca

translated: (all) shared in the bridge and the monastery.
in the city and the countryside.
(all) shared in the sand for the bridge and the monastery.

analyzed: vīthim sammajjanam katvā  kadalī puṇṇa ghaṭe dhaje
translated: Having swept the road,🔽with plantain trees, water pots, flags,
they made an offering to the Teacher.🔽Having had the bridge and the monastery built,
the Saviour of all living beings,🔽the Great Sage, the Matted Hair Ascetic,
‘When a hundred thousand aeons have passed,
she will attain the supreme Awakening.
having done service with their hands,
will all be in your presence’.
Through that deed and its result,
having been reborn in the deva-world,

analyzed: sata sahassitaḥ kappe  su katam kamma sampadā
translated: For a hundred thousand of your aeons,🔽the success of your well-done deeds;
and in the excellent city of the gods.
we always received all of these,
through the success of your well-done deeds.
we were reborn in a Brahmin family;

analyzed: na passāma na laṅkata  cikkhalla bhūmi masuci
translated: nor did we tread upon it;🔽we never saw the ground as muddy,
we never saw the Great Sage.
While we were living in the house,
Because of the fruit of our past deeds.

analyzed: sa sāra patha nitthiṇṇā  vīta rāgāḥ bhavāmase
translated: Having gone forth, not living at home,
Having crossed over the path of saṃsāra,
We are free from passion, we are free from existence.
They always bring us🔽robes, almsfood, requisites, and resting places,
From here and there, in thousands.
How welcome it was for us
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the 84,000 nuns recited these verses in the presence of the Buddha.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ caturāsītibrāhmaṇakaññābhikkhunīsahassāni bhagavato sammukhā imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Caturāsītibhikkhunīsahassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam catur asīti brāhmaṇa kaññā bhikkhunī sahassāni bhagavataḥ sammukhā imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽caturāsīti bhikkhunī sahassa apadānam dutiya
